review_title: Great place to work as a student
job_title: IT Student Worker in Lakewood, CO
pros: Great work environment and supportive management
cons: Temporary student work. Salary can be higher

pros: The amazing support of our team by the administration. Clear expectations and manageable workload. The benefits are great.
cons: Salary is lower than other organizations in a similar field.

review_title: Culture, People and Growth Opportunities 2 thumbs WAY WAY up
pros: Benefits - great, PERA, choice and perks People and Administration - Great to work with and genuine. Work/Life Balance - second to none of any job I have ever worked Tuition reimbursement
cons: Problems are sometimes not handled as immediately as they could be.

pros: Great atmosphere with great people!
cons: Part time means no benefits.

pros: The other faculty are smart and amazing. There are always professional development opportunities and extra responsibilities that do come with release time/pay. Culture is great and they continuously look for ways to improve.
cons: The pay is subpar. You work 50, 60, 70 hours per week to get all the work done.

pros: Friendly staff that all care deeply about helping students. Decent work/life balance. Good benefits.
cons: Low pay. Hesitant to making changes. No room for advancement. Not flexible with work hours.

pros: Great staff who really cares for each other!
cons: Salary is lower than other community colleges in the area.

pros: Amazing coworkers, supportive environment on the bottom. (Not a dentist, but RRCC is too small to put your real title)
cons: Concerns not addressed by management. Top heavy power structure

review_title: Long time ago in a community college far away
pros: On the job training in network engineering
cons: Extensive micromanaging by a superior with little technical skill

job_title: Child Care Specialist in Lakewood, CO
pros: The program is. very good and professional. The schedule is very consistent and you never work weekends. Managers are understanding and professional.
cons: You cannot work more than 29 hours per week.

pros: Inclusive community and wonderful supportive managers.
cons: Initial on-boarding was clumsy and confusing.

review_title: I was given all of the support I needed, but also given the freedom to run the classroom how I saw fit.
job_title: Adjunct Math Instructor in Lakewood, CO
pros: A large margin of freedom for adjunct math instructors for the structure of their class.  Night classes allowed me to work full time and teach at my other job and teach on the side.  Requirements and grade reporting are straight forward for instructors.  Overall, it was a wonderful place to work.
cons: There was minimal training for the position.  Personally, I felt prepared to take on the class, but sometimes wondered if I should have gone through more extensive training before teaching a class.  There was a bill going through congress to raise the salaries of adjunct instructors while I was working there, but it did not pass.

review_title: Great atmosphere. Wonderful interaction between faculty and students.
pros: Somewhat flexible schedule. It's a great school to work for. Staff is friendly and helpful with any problem. The majority of the student population are delightful to have in class. Most students are serious about their education. Every class is a little different but all have a pretty good feel to them. Peer faculty are fun to interact with and are helpful if a problem arises.
cons: As a part-time employee, of course, no benefits.

pros: Good students. Great help from the administrative offices. Campus located at a place that offers a nice view; it is far from pollution and noise. The Parking situation is great. and convenient. The campus is also accessible by the light rail.
cons: The salary was too small for the work load. There were no benefits and no bus passes for the students or the instructors. Changes to the teaching schedule can happen very fast and without warning. The instructor does not feel safe or valued.

review_title: Relaxed environment to tutor math with a good environment to work and help students.
pros: There are good students to work with and a pretty relaxed team of other tutors to help with math. There are lots of tutors with varying levels of math experience that can answer questions you may not know.
cons: Obviously you need to be okay with working with students who may be unwilling to actually learn, but are looking to get answers from tutors. But the majority of the students are quite good to work with.

pros:
Easy tasks
Guaranteed job if you receive a Pell Grant
Max 20 hours a week
Able to do homework during down time
Get to know lot of people at school
cons:
$8.75 max earning potential
Can only work 20 hours a week
No benefits
Although you are paid  from a grant, you  still pay taxes
Must be enrolled into 6 credit hours

pros:
Work Environment 
Work life balance
Flexibility
Appearance of professional development
Support of students
cons:
Pay is horrible
Tons of red tape. Impossible to get things done. 
Politics
VPs are a hindrance not an asset

pros: Good Benefits, nice campus (so far)
cons: Lethargic upper management, they allow racism, they over pay some and under pay others. They hire student employees to do most of the work.

review_title: Great institution to be either a student or employee.
pros: They care about people and are very charitable.  The college's focus is on the quality of life and success of the student; with this, the college treats its employees as a vital resource that must, in turn, be cared for in order to accomplish its goals.
cons: None that I have encountered so far.

pros: Great people to work for and with, it is a fun environment.
cons: Work study pay while going to school is very low.  Only allowed 20 hours per week. If you are paying rent, relying on student loans to help is the only way to make it, even sharing costs.

pros: rewarding work, excellent team and leadership, state of the art medical education facility, supportive director, an opportunity to make a difference teaching your medical area of expertise.
cons: I had no cons working for this college

pros: Decent pay, not too stressful work, good supervisors.
cons: Incompetent security professionals and bad internal policy.

pros: The campus, the diverse student population, proximity to the Front Range and some great faculty.
cons: Poor forms of support for instructors in relation to the demands that come with teaching such a wide range of students' needs and abilities.

review_title: Great place to work, friendly people in all departments
pros: Lots of friendly people, it's a smaller college - most classrooms and departments are in one building.
cons: Limited budget, lots of talk of needing to recruit more students when enrollment is down.

pros: dedicated faculty, flexible leave policy
cons: "Relational institution" often translates to hiring and decision-making being based on how random people feel about you.

pros: Good pay. Nice people. Relaxed environment.
cons: Slow, bureaucratic, management doesn't care.

pros: Good place to work. I had a lot of flexibility in my schedule.
cons: The time I had to work did not match the amount of pay I was receiving.

review_title: Worked at the cafe, the people are great but the attention from upper management wad too minimal
pros: Great people, shift meals, networking
cons: Minimum wage, and no tips allowed

job_title: Early CARE and EDUCATION SITE COACH in Lakewood, CO
pros:
Great place to work

Casual

Great benefits

Truly care about their employees
cons:
Lots of documentation required for anything you do.

Slow responses on policy questions.

pros: Culture is wonderful,  on campus events for staff. Paid Time off is very generous.
cons: Pay is below avg and Pera is horrible.

pros: Outstanding work environment and people.
cons: Current road construction around campus and the drive to and from current apartment availability.

pros: Work/life balance, community focused, Lakewood is beautiful, rec center is amazing!
cons: Low salary, not much room for internal promotion

job_title: Audio Visual Assistant in Lakewood, CO
pros: Great work environment, great boss, good peers.
cons: work can be physically intensive

pros: The family-type atmosphere is enjoyable.
cons: Sometimes the top management folks do not respond to the needs of the majority.

pros: Laid-back atmosphere and you are your own boss
cons: A little disorganized and the pay is horrible

pros: Diverse work place, flexible hours, great training
cons: Not enough pay, sometimes not challenging enough

pros: Great conversations, fun and relaxed team player environment
cons: It has to end when workstudy runs out

pros: The support systems are well managed and reliable.
cons: Instructors must create class mostly on your own.

job_title: Distribution Specialist II in Lakewood, CO
pros: Great position and reasonable pay for students.
cons: Very few hours are given to work study employees.

pros: Very nice people, easy enough work
cons: Can be very repetitive, music can help

pros: room to advance in your career
cons: don't get involved with politics
